item.title: 12 stocks with record dates for dividends, bonuses, splits, rights issue next week. Do you own? - The Economic Times
item.description:
12 stocks with record dates for dividends, bonuses, splits, rights issue next week. Do you own?

Publication Date: December 28, 2023 | Source: Economic Times

Several companies, including KPI Green Energy and RedTape, have upcoming record dates for corporate actions. Investors must hold shares before the ex-date to qualify for dividends, bonuses, or splits. The T+1 settlement system generally aligns record and ex-dates, but exceptions may occur due to market holidays.

  • Investors need to ensure shares are in their demat account by the record date.
  • If shares are bought on the ex-date, investors do not qualify for benefits.
  • Record and ex-dates typically align unless affected by market holidays.
“The record date is key for identifying shareholders eligible for these benefits.”

This week's highlighted stocks include Banco Products for a bonus issue, Harshil Agrotech and others for rights issues, along with various stock splits and dividends announced by Surya Roshni and RedTape. Investors should pay attention to these dates to maximize their benefits.

item.title: 2025 stock picks from Religare Broking with up to 29% upside potential - The Economic Times
item.description:
2025 Stock Picks from Religare Broking with Up to 29% Upside Potential

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

As we enter 2025, global markets may be shaped by shifts in U.S. trade policies, geopolitical resolutions, and a recovery in corporate earnings, supported by increased government spending and easing inflation, says a report by domestic brokerage firm Religare Broking. These factors set the stage for opportunities and challenges. Religare has identified 6 fundamentally strong stocks across various sectors poised for robust performance in 2025 with up to 29% upside:

  • HDFC Bank: Buy range: 1,720-1,810 | Target: Rs 1,920-2,008 | Upside: 11%
  • LIC: Buy range: Rs 840-900 | Target: Rs 1,045-1,160 | Upside: 29%
  • DLF: Buy range: Rs 800-850 | Target: Rs 960-1,050 | Upside: 23.5%
  • Samvardhana Motherson: Buy range: Rs 145-160 | Target: Rs 175-195 | Upside: 22%
  • Amara Raja: Buy range: 1,080-1,200 | Target: Rs 1,350-1,440 | Upside: 20%
  • Senco Gold: Buy range: Rs 1,010-1,080 | Target: Rs 1,200-1,330 | Upside: 23%
“Recommendations, suggestions, views, and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times.”

In conclusion, the identifiable stocks by Religare Broking present potential for investors as 2025 approaches, leveraging the anticipated improvements in the global economy.

item.title: 6 high growth sectors to watch for maximum investment returns in 2025 - The Financial Express
item.description:
6 High Growth Sectors to Watch for Maximum Investment Returns in 2025

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: Financial Express

The world is rapidly going digital, creating fresh opportunities for innovation and growth. In October 2024, India saw 7.42 billion UPI transactions, highlighting the country's shift towards digital services. Financial literacy and inclusion have increased access to formal financial services, making India an attractive market for global investors.

  • Banking & Financial Services: The fintech market in India is expected to grow at a CAGR of 20% by 2030, with a focus on mid-sized private banks.
  • Information Technology: Indian IT firms are essential to global digital transformation with a market size of $245 billion.
  • Consumer Goods: The FMCG market is projected to reach $220 billion by 2025, driven by the middle class's spending power.
  • Healthcare & Pharmaceuticals: India holds 20% of the global generic drug market, with potential for growth in biotechnology and telemedicine.
  • Infrastructure & Capital Goods: With a government investment plan of ₹111 lakh crore, the infrastructure sector is geared for growth.
  • Real Estate: Demand for luxury properties is rising, especially in key urban regions.
“By aligning your portfolio with these growth-driving sectors, you can capitalize on opportunities shaping India’s economic future.”

In conclusion, keeping an eye on these sectors can help investors leverage potential growth areas as India moves towards a more digitally-savvy economy.

item.title: India's car race: How far EVs went in 2024 - The Economic Times
item.description:
India's Car Race: Electric Vehicle Sales Surge in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Economic Times

The automobile industry in India experienced modest growth in 2024, but electric vehicles saw a substantial increase in sales, marking a significant shift towards EV adoption.

  • Overall automobile sales grew by just 0.5% in the April-September quarter.
  • Electric vehicle sales increased by over 25% compared to the previous fiscal year.
  • From April 1 to November 30, 2024, 1.3 million EVs were registered in India.
  • Electric two-wheelers accounted for 60% of total EV sales.
  • The government launched the PM E-Drive scheme to incentivize EV adoption with a budget of Rs 10,900 crore.
  • Major new EV models were launched by companies such as Tata, Mahindra, and MG in 2024.
The Minister of State for Heavy Industries stated, "13.06 lakh EVs were registered in the country from April to November 2024."

In summary, 2024 saw a notable rise in electric vehicle adoption in India driven by consumer demand and government initiatives, highlighting a transition towards more sustainable transportation options.

item.title: New Kia Sonet surpasses 1 lakh sales in 11 months - The Financial Express
item.description:
New Kia Sonet Surpasses 1 Lakh Sales in 11 Months

Date: February 2025
Source: Financial Express

Kia's new Sonet has achieved remarkable sales, surpassing the 1 lakh mark in just 11 months since its launch in January 2024, averaging nearly 10,000 sales per month.

  • The Sonet is available in a lineup of 22 variants with 6 powertrain options.
  • 76% of sales come from petrol variants, while diesel comprises 24%.
  • 34% of total sales are from automatic transmissions.
  • A notable 79% of purchased variants are equipped with sunroofs.
“When we introduced the New Sonet, it came with several best in segment features, premiumizing the segment. These features have significantly enhanced the value proposition of the New Sonet, contributing to strong sales performance.” - Hardeep Singh Brar, Sr. VP and Head of Sales and Marketing

This achievement highlights the market's positive reception of the Kia Sonet, driven by its competitive pricing and feature-rich offerings.

item.title: Stock market holidays 2025: NSE, BSE to remain closed on THESE days next year | Check FULL LIST - ET Now
item.description:
Stock market holidays 2025: NSE, BSE to remain closed on THESE days next year | Check FULL LIST

Date & Source: Updated Dec 28, 2024 09:42 IST, ETNOW

The Indian stock market will remain closed for 14 days in 2025 owing to various festivities affecting the NSE and BSE operations.

  • 14 trading holidays are scheduled for the Indian stock market in 2025.
  • The holidays affect equities, equity derivatives, and SLB segments.
  • Notable holidays include Maha Shivratri on February 26 and Diwali-Balipratipada on October 22.
  • Muhurat Trading will be conducted on October 21, 2025.
“The stock market will remain closed for 14 days or there will be 14 trading holidays in 2025.”

In conclusion, investors should mark these holidays to plan their trading activities for 2025 effectively.

item.title: Small-cap stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommend six shares to buy on Monday — 30 December 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Small-cap stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommend six shares to buy

Date: 30 December 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market is trading sideways, with the Nifty 50 index struggling to surpass key resistance levels. Experts recommend six small-cap stocks priced under ₹100 for investors looking to make purchases on Monday.

  • The Nifty 50 closed at 23,832, while the BSE Sensex was at 78,732.
  • Small-cap indices saw a slight gain of 0.15% amid a generally subdued market trend.
  • Market analysts are cautiously optimistic, with recommendations for stocks such as NHPC, Infibeam Avenues, Cupid, NACL Industries, MMTC, and Meghmani Organics.

Notable Quotes:

Nagaraj Shetti: "The short-term trend of the Nifty 50 index is slightly positive with range-bound action."

Recommended Stocks:

  1. **NHPC:** Buy at ₹80, target ₹84.50, stop loss ₹78.
  2. **Infibeam Avenues:** Buy at ₹26, target ₹28.40, stop loss ₹24.60.
  3. **MMTC:** Buy at ₹72 to ₹73, targets ₹77 to ₹88, stop loss ₹68.
  4. **Meghmani Organics:** Buy at ₹76 to ₹77.50, targets ₹82 to ₹92, stop loss ₹74.
  5. **Cupid:** Buy at ₹77.50, target ₹83.50, stop loss ₹74.50.
  6. **NACL Industries:** Buy at ₹65, target ₹70, stop loss ₹63.

Investors are encouraged to consult with certified experts before making investment decisions.

item.title: ‘Real madness, too much money’: Mumbai woman gets mini bag worth ₹27 lakh to ‘carry her lipstick’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mumbai Mother Gifts Daughter ₹27 Lakh Mini Bag for Honeymoon

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A viral video captures a Mumbai mother and daughter who traveled to purchase a luxurious Hermes Kelly bag worth ₹27 lakh, with the daughter wanting a compact option for her honeymoon.

  • Mother and daughter purchased a mini Hermes Kelly bag in a shop.
  • The daughter preferred a smaller bag for its compact and stylish appeal to carry her lipstick.
  • The video sparked mixed reactions online regarding spending on luxury items.
“Real madness, too much money.” - Comment from a social media user

The event has reignited discussions about luxury spending and its implications on social status.

item.title: Barclays fires 15 Wall Street bankers before Christmas holidays, axes bonuses in brutal layoff move: Repo - The Times of India
item.description:
Barclays fires 15 Wall Street bankers before Christmas holidays, axes bonuses in brutal layoff move: Report

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Barclays has taken the decision to lay off 15 bankers from its Wall Street division as part of a broader strategy to cut costs, eliminating bonuses as part of the process just before the Christmas holidays.

  • 15 Wall Street bankers are reported to be laid off.
  • The bank has canceled bonuses amid cost-cutting measures.
  • This move reflects ongoing challenges faced by financial institutions.
"The layoffs are a clear sign that even top banks are not immune to the pressures of the current economic climate and the challenging financial landscape." - Financial Analyst

This significant move by Barclays highlights the increasingly competitive nature of the financial sector, especially as firms look to streamline operations in challenging market conditions.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Allotment Status OUT: Check online by PAN Number on Kfin Technologies - ET Now
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Allotment Status OUT: Check online by PAN Number on Kfin Technologies

Updated: December 28, 2024 07:52 IST

The Unimech Aerospace IPO allotment status is available. Investors can check their allotment status online using their PAN number on the Kfin Technologies registrar website.

Key Points

  • Investors can check allotment status by visiting Kfin Technologies' official webpage.
  • The IPO was priced at Rs 745-785 per share, and the GMP is Rs 666, indicating a strong demand.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

It showcases the high interest in Unimech's shares within the primary market.

Conclusion

This article provides essential information for investors looking to check the allotment status and highlights the significant demand for Unimech Aerospace shares in the IPO market.

item.title: The most underrated SIP hack for a bigger mutual fund corpus | Mint - Mint
item.description:
The Most Underrated SIP Hack for a Bigger Mutual Fund Corpus

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Live Mint

Investors often pursue high returns by chasing top-performing mutual funds, but this strategy may not be the best way to build a significant corpus.

Top Performing Mutual Funds Keep Changing

It's important to realize that past performance does not guarantee future results. For instance, mutual funds that excelled in a bull market may not perform well in a bear market and vice versa. Here are the top 3 flexicap funds for two different 3-year periods:

Rank3 Year Period Ended 26 Dec 20223 Year Period Ended 26 Dec 2024
1Quant Flexicap (37.58%)JM Flexicap (28.46%)
2PGIM India Flexicap (24.58%)HDFC Flexicap (25.59%)
3Parag Parikh Flexicap (24.32%)Motilal Oswal Flexicap (24.32%)
Source: AMFI

So, What Should You Do?

Instead of chasing the highest returns, consider increasing your Systematic Investment Plan (SIP) amount. Consistently raising your SIP can have a profound impact due to the power of compounding. For example, JM Flexicap Fund delivered a 28.46% return; a ₹10,000 SIP over three years could yield a corpus of ₹5.72 lakh. In comparison, an ₹12,000 SIP in HDFC Flexicap Fund, with a 24.32% return, could accumulate a corpus of ₹6.40 lakh.

“A steady increase in your SIP can have a much more profound effect over time due to the power of compounding,” said Dr. Ravi Singh, SVP - Retail Research, Religare Broking Ltd.

Over the long term, even small differences in return can result in significant changes in your corpus.

Disclaimer: The views and recommendations made above are those of individual analysts, not of Mint. We advise investors to check with certified experts before making investment decisions.

item.title: A quick-commerce correction on the radar for consumer brands | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Quick Commerce Trends for Consumer Brands in 2025

Publication Date: 2024-12-01 Source: Company Business News

As quick commerce gained momentum in the direct-to-consumer market during 2024, brands are now reconsidering their reliance on instant delivery services for the upcoming year.

  • Brands such as Wellbeing Nutrition and Arata are shifting towards diverse distribution methods.
  • There's a growing focus on using own websites and physical stores to minimize dependency on quick commerce.
"Our strategy for 2025 involves a significant reduction in reliance on quick commerce platforms, ensuring sustainability and flexibility in our operations." - Industry Executive

The shift indicates a transitional phase for consumer brands adapting to market changes and exploring new sales channels.

item.title: From Rs 20 Lakh A Day To Zero, Startup Founder Shares How Amazon Ended His Dream - News18
item.description:
From Rs 20 Lakh A Day To Zero: Startup Founder Shares How Amazon Ended His Dream

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: News18

An Indian startup founder shared his journey from earning Rs 20 lakh daily to a complete business collapse. His home organizer company faced fierce competition when Amazon launched a competing brand, disrupting his successful venture.

  • The founder initially achieved significant sales success on Amazon and Flipkart, generating Rs 20 lakh daily.
  • After a promising start, Amazon's entry into the market with a similar product caused his revenues to plummet.
  • He reflects on his experience and emphasizes the importance of diversifying sales platforms and being wary of large corporations.
  • The founder highlights the urgency of adapting to market changes, warning against over-reliance on one sales platform.
  • Despite setbacks, he remains optimistic about his future and learned valuable lessons about business resilience.
“I went from selling 20L of products per day to watching my generational-wealth dream crumble under Amazon.”

This story underlines the volatile nature of entrepreneurship in competitive industries and the impact of dominant market players like Amazon on small businesses.

item.title: Rupee hits new low of 85.80/$, biggest 1-day fall in 2 years - The Times of India
item.description:
Rupee hits new low of 85.80/$, biggest 1-day fall in 2 years

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Indian rupee has dropped to a new low of 85.80 against the US dollar, marking the largest one-day decline in two years. Analysts express concerns over the impact of rising crude oil prices and geopolitical tensions on the Indian economy.

  • The rupee's decline is the steepest in the last 24 months.
  • Factors influencing the drop include international crude prices and domestic economic indicators.
  • There is growing speculation about the RBI's potential intervention to stabilize the currency.
“This sudden fall reflects the market's nervousness amid global economic pressures,” said an economist.

The fall of the rupee has raised significant concerns among economists and policymakers about future economic stability.

item.title: What’s ‘One Cabin Bag’ Rule For Indian Flyers? All You Need To Know About New Luggage Restrictions - News18
item.description:
What’s ‘One Cabin Bag’ Rule For Indian Flyers? All You Need To Know About New Luggage Restrictions

Last Updated: December 27, 2024, 17:36 IST

The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has proposed new restrictions on hand luggage on flights to manage the increasing number of passengers and ease air travel. Passengers can now bring only one handbag or cabin bag on board a domestic or international flight.

  • Only one handbag of up to 7 kg is allowed for Economy and Higher Economy passengers; First and Business Class may carry up to 10 kg.
  • Handbag dimensions cannot exceed 55 cm in height, 40 cm in length, and 20 cm in width.
  • Extra weight or size will attract baggage fees.
  • Passengers who purchased tickets before May 4, 2024, are exempt from the new weight restrictions.
“Passengers carried by domestic airlines during January-November 2024 were 1,464.02 lakh as against 1,382.34 lakh during the corresponding period of the previous year, thereby registering an annual growth of 5.91 per cent and monthly growth of 11.90%.” - Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA)

The new restrictions aim to streamline air travel as passenger numbers continue to rise significantly.

item.title: OpenAI outlines new for-profit structure in bid to stay ahead in costly AI race - Reuters
item.description:
OpenAI outlines new for-profit structure in bid to stay ahead in costly AI race

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Reuters

OpenAI announced plans to restructure as a public benefit corporation to attract more capital for advancing AI development amidst intense competition.

  • OpenAI aims to create a public benefit corporation to facilitate funding.
  • The move comes amid criticism from Elon Musk and Meta regarding OpenAI's for-profit shift.
  • The nonprofit arm will retain a significant interest in the new structure as shares.
  • The switch reflects a growing need for investment in AI development.
  • The restructuring may raise questions about balancing profit and social good.
"Investors want to back us but, at this scale of capital, need conventional equity and less structural bespokeness." - OpenAI Statement

OpenAI's transformation to a public benefit corporation represents a critical strategy to secure necessary funding as competition in AI escalates.

item.title: Viral post claims Indian CEO 'ruined' US company by laying off 15% workforce to replace them with Indian nationals | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Viral Post Accuses Indian CEO of 'Ruining' US Company Through Layoffs

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Following debates about Indian immigrants taking jobs from US citizens, a viral post by a US attorney claims an Indian CEO 'ruined' a US company by laying off 15% of its staff and replacing management with Indian employees.

  • The attorney states the CEO replaced experienced employees, pushing out founders and altering the leadership.
  • The company's client satisfaction reportedly decreased after the management change.
  • The post gained over 8 million views, sparking discussions about racism and the complexities of employment practices.
“He pushed out all the founders and replaced all the C-suite with Indian. He laid off 15% of the workforce, almost exclusively the most experienced employees.”

This incident highlights the ongoing tensions around employment and immigration in the US tech sector.

item.title: Food spending rises in rural areas, gap with urban centres shrinks - The Indian Express
item.description:
Food Spending Rises in Rural Areas, Gap with Urban Centres Shrinks

Publication Date: 2023-24 - Source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

The share of food in monthly household expenditure has increased in both rural and urban areas according to the latest HCES fact sheet, reversing a declining trend.

  • The share of food in rural households rose to 47.04% in 2023-24, while urban households saw it inch up to 39.68%.
  • The gap in average monthly consumption expenditure (MCE) between rural and urban households narrowed to 69.7%.
  • Rural average monthly spending rose by 9.3% to Rs 4,122; urban spending increased by 8.3% to Rs 6,996.
  • The top 5% in both rural and urban sectors saw a decrease in consumption spending.
  • Consumption inequality has declined, with the Gini coefficient falling in both areas.
“The urban-rural gap in MPCE has declined, confirming sustained momentum of consumption growth in rural areas,” said the Ministry.

This data indicates a significant shift in consumption patterns, with rural areas experiencing a robust increase in spending relative to urban centers, suggesting changing economic dynamics.

item.title: Wall Street Today: US stocks extend holiday-thin trading dragged by Nvidia, set for 1% weekly gain; S&P up 25% YTD | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
US Stocks Struggle as Nvidia Weighs Down Market; S&P 500 Gains 25% Year-to-Date

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

The major US stock indices opened lower amidst a dip in trading on December 27, 2024, as Nvidia and other tech stocks dragged down the market, although many indices remain on track for weekly gains.

  • The S&P 500 fell 1.4%, with over 80% of its stocks declining.
  • The Dow Jones dropped 402 points (0.9%) to 42,945, while the Nasdaq fell 2%.
  • Nvidia shares fell 3.2%, affecting the broader tech sector performance.
  • Despite the current dip, the S&P 500 is projected to end the year up 25%, marking a second consecutive year of over 20% gains.
  • The dollar index is expected to end the year nearly 7% higher.
"The gains have been driven partly by upbeat economic data showing that consumers continued spending and the labor market remained strong."

In conclusion, while US stocks experienced a downturn due to holiday-thinned trading and tech stock performances, the overall yearly trend remains positive, with significant gains anticipated for the S&P 500.

item.title: Jio Unlimited 5G Data Gifting Voucher: One-time payment at jio.com! Plan price, how to avail benefits details - ET Now
item.description:
Jio Launches ₹601 Unlimited 5G Data Gifting Voucher

Updated: Dec 27, 2024 22:06 IST | Source: ET Now

Reliance Jio has introduced the ‘₹601 Jio True 5G gift voucher offer 2024’, allowing prepaid subscribers to unlock unlimited 5G data for a year with a one-time payment.

  • Jio is expanding its 5G user base with this new voucher, which also enhances 4G data benefits.
  • Customers purchasing the ₹601 voucher will receive 12 5G upgrade vouchers, valid for continuous connectivity throughout the year.
  • On activation, a customer gains access to 3GB of high-speed data along with unlimited 5G data.
“For activating the 5G Upgrade Voucher select MyJio 'Voucher' tab and redeem voucher on monthly mobility active plans of 1.5 per day entitlement,”

To avail the ₹601 voucher, subscribers must be active prepaid customers on plans offering at least 1.5 GB of 4G data per day, such as the ₹199, ₹239, and ₹299 plans.

item.title: Luxury car boom: Six vehicles over Rs 50 lakh sold every hour in India in 2024 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Luxury Car Boom: Six Vehicles Over Rs 50 Lakh Sold Every Hour in India in 2024

Published on: December 27, 2024

Source: Economic Times

The luxury car market in India is experiencing remarkable growth, with six cars priced over Rs 50 lakh sold every hour in 2023, a significant increase from two cars five years ago. Projections suggest that sales will continue to rise, surpassing 50,000 units by 2025, thanks to a rising number of affluent consumers and an influx of new luxury car models.

  • Luxury car sales surged to six units sold every hour in 2023.
  • Sales expected to exceed 50,000 units by 2025.
  • Luxury carmakers plan more than two dozen new launches in 2025.
  • High-end market growth is attributed to the expanding affluent class.
  • Mercedes-Benz anticipates nearly 20,000 units sold in 2024, showing 13% sales growth for 2023.
  • India's ultra-high-net-worth individuals expected to increase by 50% by 2028.
“We expect the industry to grow around 8-10% in 2025,” said Balbir Singh Dillion, Head, Audi India.

This surge indicates robust demand and an optimistic outlook for the luxury auto sector in India, reinforcing its vast growth potential.
